citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The non-affiliated member of the Committee at the UTEP research facility is the current Attending Veterinarian at another
USDA registered research facility in the local area. Use of an affiliate in the regulated research community, such as an
Attending Veterinarian, as a non-affiliated member of the IACUC does not meet the intention of the Secretary for general
community representation and may lead to conflict of interest in animal research. The Committee shall be composed of a
Chairman and at least two additional members, one of which shall not be affiliated in any way with the facility other than
as a member of the Committee, and shall not be a member of the immediate family of a person who is affiliated with the
facility. The Secretary intends that such person will provide representation for general community interests in the proper
care and treatment of animals.
Correct by 30 April 2025 or the next IACUC meeting.

When requested to see documentation of annual reviews of the contingency plan, a facility representative could not find
any. Failure to document annual reviews and modifications of the contingency plan may lead to errors in executing the
plan that can result in poor animal handling during emergencies. Each registrant must maintain documentation of their
annual reviews, including documenting any amendments or changes made to their plan since their previous year's review.
Contingency plans, as well as all annual review documentation must be made available to APHIS upon request.
Correct by 27 May 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
